DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type of tissue collected from the donor.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Where something is available or from where it originates._A position in relation to its surroundings.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: Where something is available or from where it originates.:A position in relation to its surroundings.

Concepts.definition: Where something is available or from where it originates.
A position in relation to its surroundings.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concepts linked to Tissue Banking and Pathology activities

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Either of the paired male reproductive glands that produce the male germ cells and the male hormones.

Concepts.definition: Either of the paired male reproductive glands that produce the male germ cells and the male hormones.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.

Concepts.definition: The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The female genital canal, extending from the uterus to the vulva.

Concepts.definition: The female genital canal, extending from the uterus to the vulva.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A hollow, thick-walled, muscular organ located within the pelvic cavity of a woman. Within the uterus the fertilized egg implants and the fetus develops during pregnancy.

Concepts.definition: A hollow, thick-walled, muscular organ located within the pelvic cavity of a woman. Within the uterus the fertilized egg implants and the fetus develops during pregnancy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of the paired female reproductive glands containing the ova or germ cells; the ovary's stroma is a vascular connective tissue containing numbers of ovarian follicles enclosing the ova.

Concepts.definition: One of the paired female reproductive glands containing the ova or germ cells; the ovary's stroma is a vascular connective tissue containing numbers of ovarian follicles enclosing the ova.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A small salivary gland located in the oral cavity.  It produces saliva.

Concepts.definition: A small salivary gland located within the aerodigestive tract.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A fold of peritoneum originating at the stomach and supporting the viscera.

Concepts.definition: A fold of peritoneum originating at the stomach and supporting the viscera.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The anatomical location where the esophagus joins to the stomach.

Concepts.definition: The anatomical location where the esophagus joins to the stomach.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The portion of the colon that connects to the descending colon above and the rectum below.

Concepts.definition: The portion of the colon that connects to the descending colon above and the rectum below.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The final section of the small intestine.

Concepts.definition: The final section of the small intestine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An endocrine gland located at the base of the neck that produces and secretes thyroxine and other hormones. Thyroxine is important for metabolic control.

Concepts.definition: An endocrine gland located at the base of the neck that produces and secretes thyroxine and other hormones. Thyroxine is important for metabolic control.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ located under the diaphragm, between the liver and the spleen as well as between the esophagus and the small intestine. The stomach is the primary organ of food digestion.

Concepts.definition: The primary organ of food digestion. It is located under the diaphragm, between the liver and the spleen as well as between the esophagus and the small intestine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ that is part of the lymphatic system. The spleen produces lymphocytes, filters the blood, stores blood cells, and destroys old blood cells. It is located on the left side of the abdomen near the stomach.

Concepts.definition: An organ that is part of the hematopoietic and immune systems. It is composed of the white pulp and the red pulp and is surrounded by a capsule. It is located in the left hypochondriac region. Its functions include lymphocyte production, blood cell storage, and blood cell destruction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pea-sized endocrine gland located at the base of the brain in the pituitary fossa. It produces and secretes hormones such as oxytocin and vasopressin, to regulate the activities of the hypothalamus.

Concepts.definition: Pea-sized endocrine gland located at the base of the brain in the pituitary fossa. It produces and secretes hormones such as oxytocin and vasopressin, to regulate the activities of the hypothalamus.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A non-encapsulated elongated and lobulated organ, extending from the concavity of the duodenum to the spleen; it consists of a head, an elongated body, and a tail. It contains two functional components: an exocrine component that secretes juices into the intestine and an endocrine component that secretes hormones (insulin and glucagon).

Concepts.definition: An organ behind the lower part of the stomach that is the shape of a fish and about the size of a hand. It is a compound gland composed of both exocrine and endocrine tissues. The endocrine pancreas makes insulin so that the body can use glucose (sugar) for energy. The exocrine pancreas makes enzymes that help the body digest food. Spread all over the pancreas are areas called the Islets of Langerhans. The cells in these areas each have a special purpose. The alpha cells make glucagon, which raises the level of glucose in the blood; the beta cells make insulin; the delta cells make somatostatin. There are also PP cells and D1 cells, about which little is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

Concepts.definition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

Concepts.definition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or relating to a cavity or chamber in the body, especially one of the upper chambers of the heart.: A natural prolongation or projection from a part of an organism either animal or plant; a part that is joined to something larger.

Concepts.definition: Of or relating to a cavity or chamber in the body, especially one of the upper chambers of the heart.
A natural prolongation or projection from a part of an organism either animal or plant; a part that is joined to something larger.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The outer zone of the KIDNEY, beneath the capsule, consisting of KIDNEY GLOMERULUS; KIDNEY TUBULES, DISTAL; and KIDNEY TUBULES, PROXIMAL. (MSH2001)

Concepts.definition: The outer part of the renal parenchyma beneath the renal capsule. It contains glomeruli and tubules.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A hollow muscular organ which receives the blood from the veins and propels it into the arteries. It is divided by a musculomembranous septum into two halves -- right or venous and left or arterial -- each of which consists of a receiving chamber (atrium) and an ejecting chamber (ventricle). SYN cor, coeur.

Concepts.definition: A hollow organ located slightly to the left of the middle portion of the chest. It is composed of muscle and it is divided by a septum into two sides: the right side which receives de-oxygenated blood from the body and the left side which sends newly oxygenated blood to the body. Each side is composed of two chambers: the atrium (receiving blood) and ventricle (ejecting blood).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A principal artery that originates in the aorta. It supplies blood to the muscular tissue of the heart.

Concepts.definition: One of two arteries that arise from the aortic sinuses of the ascending aorta and supply blood to the myocardium

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The part of the large intestine measured from the cecum to the rectum consisting of ascending, transverse, descending and sigmoid portions. The purpose of the colon is to remove water from digested food prior to excretion.

Concepts.definition: The part of the large intestine measured from the cecum to the rectum consisting of ascending, transverse, descending and sigmoid portions. The purpose of the colon is to remove water from digested food prior to excretion.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The glandular tissue of the breast.  In females, it is composed of numerous lobules with alveolar ducts and alveoli.  In males, it is composed of rudimentary glands.

Concepts.definition: The glandular tissue of the breast.  In females, it is composed of numerous lobules with alveolar ducts and alveoli.  In males, it is composed of rudimentary glands.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The outer layer of the cerebrum composed of neurons and unmyelinated nerve fibers. It is responsible for memory, attention, consciousness and other higher levels of mental function.

Concepts.definition: The outer layer of the cerebrum composed of neurons and unmyelinated nerve fibers. It is responsible for memory, attention, consciousness and other higher levels of mental function.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The portion of the brain located at the base of the skull that is responsible for balance, equilibrium and movement.

Concepts.definition: The portion of the brain located at the base of the skull that is responsible for balance, equilibrium and movement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The major arterial trunk that carries oxygenated blood from the left ventricle into the ascending aorta behind the heart, the aortic arch, through the thorax as the descending aorta and through the abdomen as the abdominal aorta; it bifurcates into the left and right common iliac arteries.

Concepts.definition: The major arterial trunk that carries oxygenated blood from the left ventricle into the ascending aorta behind the heart, the aortic arch, through the thorax as the descending aorta and through the abdomen as the abdominal aorta; it bifurcates into the left and right common iliac arteries.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A flattened, roughly triangular body resting upon the upper end of each kidney; it is one of the ductless glands furnishing internal secretions (epinephrine and norepinephrine from the medulla and steroid hormones from the cortex).

Concepts.definition: A flattened, roughly triangular body resting upon the upper end of each kidney; it is one of the ductless glands furnishing internal secretions (epinephrine and norepinephrine from the medulla and steroid hormones from the cortex).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.

Concepts.definition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of two major branches of the sciatic nerve. It innervates the muscles of the posterior aspect of the lower limb, the muscles of the plantar aspect of the foot, as well as the skin on the posterior aspect of the leg and on the sole of the foot.

Concepts.definition: One of two major branches of the sciatic nerve. It innervates the muscles of the posterior aspect of the lower limb, the muscles of the plantar aspect of the foot, as well as the skin on the posterior aspect of the leg and on the sole of the foot.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Striated muscles that are under voluntary control of the organism. They are connected at either or both ends to a bone and are utilized for locomotion and other movements. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: Striated muscles that are under voluntary control of the organism.  They are connected at either or both ends to a bone and are utilized for locomotion and other movements.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any of the tibial arteries including the anterior and posterior tibial arteries and the anterior and posterior recurrent tibial arteries.

Concepts.definition: Any of the tibial arteries including the anterior and posterior tibial arteries and the anterior and posterior recurrent tibial arteries.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Connective tissue composed of fat cells lodged in the meshes of areolar tissue.

Concepts.definition: A specialized form of connective tissue consisting primarily of adipocytes (fat cells), surrounded by a meshwork of collagen fibers.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.: Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight.

Concepts.definition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.
Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

Concepts.definition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The filamentous outgrowth of the epidermis.

Concepts.definition: The filamentous outgrowth of the epidermis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Whole; including all components without exception; being one unit or constituting the full amount or extent or duration; complete.: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.

Concepts.definition: Including all components without exception; constituting the full amount or extent or duration; complete.
An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The skin above the pubic area.

Concepts.definition: The skin above the pubic area.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The lining of the esophagus. It is composed of non-keratinized stratified squamous epithelium, lamina propria, and muscularis mucosa.

Concepts.definition: The lining of the esophagus. It is composed of non-keratinized stratified squamous epithelium, lamina propria, and muscularis mucosa.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The layer of muscularis mucosa in the esophageal wall. It is thicker than the muscularis mucosa of the stomach and intestine. It is composed of longitudinal muscle fibers.

Concepts.definition: The layer of muscularis mucosa in the esophageal wall. It is thicker than the muscularis mucosa of the stomach and intestine. It is composed of longitudinal muscle fibers.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A jointed tube 25-30 cm long that connects the stomach to the jejunum.: A usually exophytic mass attached to the underlying tissue by a broad base or a thin stalk.  Polyps can be neoplastic or non-neoplastic.  Neoplastic polyps usually represent proliferations of the epithelium, and are commonly seen in the gastrointestinal tract.  Polyps of the gastrointestinal tract are often called adenomas, are associated with dysplasia, and may eventually transform into carcinomas.  Non-neoplastic polyps may be inflammatory, degenerative, or the result of malformations.

Concepts.definition: A jointed tube 25-30 cm long that connects the stomach to the jejunum.

A usually exophytic mass attached to the underlying tissue by a broad base or a thin stalk.  Polyps can be neoplastic or non-neoplastic.  Neoplastic polyps usually represent proliferations of the epithelium, and are commonly seen in the gastrointestinal tract.  Polyps of the gastrointestinal tract are often called adenomas, are associated with dysplasia, and may eventually transform into carcinomas.  Non-neoplastic polyps may be inflammatory, degenerative, or the result of malformations.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.: Of or pertaining to the rectum.: Mucous membrane.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
Of or pertaining to the rectum.
Mucous membrane.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.: A jointed tube 25-30 cm long that connects the stomach to the jejunum.: Mucous membrane.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
A jointed tube 25-30 cm long that connects the stomach to the jejunum.
Mucous membrane.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm._The area where the sigmoid colon joins the rectum._The mucus membrane lining the inner surface of the colon.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
The area where the sigmoid colon joins the rectum.
The mucus membrane lining the inner surface of the colon.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A polypoid lesion that arises from the colon and protrudes into the lumen.  This group includes adenomatous polyps, serrated polyps, and hamartomatous polyps.

Concepts.definition: A polypoid lesion that arises from the colon and protrudes into the lumen.  This group includes adenomatous polyps, serrated polyps, and hamartomatous polyps.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
